actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to improve the administration of the provisions thereof relating to compensation for Government employee work injuries through the establishment of a medical review board to review occupational disease claims.

summary.text: Requires that occupational disease claims by Federal employees be reviewed by an impartial medical review board. Authorizes the Secretary of Labor to appoint such a board. Specifies guidelines and procedures to be followed by the board in the determination and settlement of cases. Sets forth standards to be applied in determining whether a disease or illness is work related. Permits judicial review of board decisions by district courts of the United States.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to improve the administration of the provisions thereof relating to compensation for Government employee work injuries through the establishment of a medical review board to review occupational disease claims.
